outputErrorGeneric(&output, global.isStructuredOutput(), \"cannot access workspace\") catch {};\n            allocator.free(issues_path);\n            allocator.free(events_path);\n            return };\n\n        corruption_count = load_result.jsonl_corruption_count;\n        corrupt_lines = load_result.jsonl_corrupt_lines;\n\n        // Warn user about corruption (unless quiet/silent mode)\n const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n  const actor = global.actor orelse getDefaultActor();\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    var generator = IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    var issue_count = store.countTotal();\n\n    // Parse input and create issues\n    switch (batch_args.format) {\n        .titles => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n                if (trimmed.len > 500) continue; // Skip titles that are too workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, issue.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(imported_issues.issues);\n        if (imported_issues.corrupt_lines.len > 0) {\n            allocator.free(imported_issues.corrupt_lines);\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (import_args.dry_run) {\n        // Dry run - just report what would be imported\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(ImportResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_imported = imported_issues.issues.len,\n                .issues_skipped = imported_issues.corruption_count,\n                .message = \"dry run - no         // Merge mode: update if exists, insert if not\n            if (try store.exists(issue.id)) {\n                // Update existing issue\n                store.update(issue.id, .{\n                    .title = issue.title,\n                    .description = issue.description,\n                    .status = issue.status,\n                    .priority = issue.priority,\n                    .issue_type = issue.issue_type,\n                    .assignee = issue.assignee,\n                }, now) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n                };\n                updated_count += 1;\n            } else {\n                store.insert(issue) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n                };\n                imported_count += 1;\n            }\n        } else {\n            // Replace mode: skip if exists\n            if (try store.exists(issue.id)) {\n                skipped_count += Batch operations for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! - `bz add-batch` - Create multiple issues from stdin/file with single lock\n//! - `bz import <file>` - Import issues from JSONL file with single lock\n//!\n//! These operations reduce lock contention for bulk operations by acquiring\n//! a single lock, performing all insertions, and releasing.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst id_gen = @import(\"../id/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst IssueStore = storage.IssueStore;\nconst JsonlFile = storage.JsonlFile;\nconst IdGenerator = id_gen.IdGenerator;\n\npub const BatchError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    InvalidInput,\n    FileReadError,\n    NoIssuesToAdd,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const BatchResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_created: ?usize = null,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    ids: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub const ImportResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    issues_updated: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Run the add-batch command.\n/// Creates multiple issues with a single lock acquisition and fsync.\npub fn runAddBatch(\n    batch_args: args.AddBatchArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return BatchError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return BatchError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Read input from file\n    const file_path = batch_args.file orelse {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"file path required. Use 'bz add-batch <file>' or 'bz add-batch --file <file>'\");\n        return BatchError.InvalidInput;\n    };\n\n    const input_content = readFileContent(file_path, allocator) catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read input file\");\n        return BatchError.FileReadError;\n    };\n    defer allocator.free(input_content);\n\n    // Parse input based on format\n    var issues_to_add: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (issues_to_add.items) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        issues_to_add.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues to get count for ID generation\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    // Get config prefix\n    const prefix = try getConfigPrefix(allocator, beads_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n\n    // Get actor\n    const actor = global.actor orelse getDefaultActor();\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    var generator = IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    var issue_count = store.countTotal();\n\n    // Parse input and create issues\n    switch (batch_args.format) {\n        .titles => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n                if (trimmed.len > 500) continue; // Skip titles that are too long\n\n                const issue_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                errdefer allocator.free(issue_id);\n                issue_count += 1;\n\n                var issue = Issue.init(issue_id, trimmed, now);\n                issue.created_by = actor;\n\n                // Clone strings for owned storage\n                const cloned = try issue.clone(allocator);\n                allocator.free(issue_id); // clone made its own copy\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, cloned);\n            }\n        },\n        .jsonl => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n\n                // Parse as Issue JSON\n                const parsed = std.json.parseFromSlice(\n                    Issue,\n                    allocator,\n                    trimmed,\n                    .{ .ignore_unknown_fields = true, .allocate = .alloc_always },\n                ) catch continue; // Skip malformed entries\n\n                // If no ID, generate one\n                var issue = parsed.value;\n                if (issue.id.len == 0) {\n                    const new_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                    allocator.free(issue.id);\n                    issue.id = new_id;\n                    issue_count += 1;\n                }\n\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, issue);\n            }\n        },\n    }\n\n    if (issues_to_add.items.len == 0) {\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_created = 0,\n                .message = \"no issues to add\",\n            });\n        } else if (!global.quiet) {\n            try output.info(\"No issues to add\", .{});\n        }\n        return;\n    }\n\n    // Insert all issues (single save at end)\n    var created_ids: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            allocator.free(id);\n        }\n        created_ids.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues_to_add.items) |issue| {\n        store.insert(issue) catch |err| switch (err) {\n            error.DuplicateId => continue, // Skip duplicates\n            else => {\n                try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to insert issue\");\n                return BatchError.StorageError;\n            },\n        };\n        const id_copy = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue.id);\n        try created_ids.append(allocator, id_copy);\n    }\n\n    // Single atomic save\n    if (!global.no_auto_flush) {\n        store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to save issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        };\n    }\n\n    // Output result\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issues_created = created_ids.items.len,\n            .ids = created_ids.items,\n        });\n    } else if (global.quiet) {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            try output.raw(id);\n            try output.raw(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    } else {\n        try output.success(\"Created {d} issue(s)\", .{created_ids.items.len});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Run the import command.\n/// Imports issues from a JSONL file with single lock acquisition.\npub fn runImport(\n    import_args: args.ImportArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const These operations reduce lock contention for bulk operations by acquiring\n//! a single lock, performing all insertions, and releasing.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try Parse input based on format\n    var issues_to_add: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (issues_to_add.items) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        issues_to_add.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues to get count for ID generation\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    // Get config prefix\n    const prefix = try common.getConfigPrefix(allocator, beads_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n\n    // Get actor\n    const actor = global.actor orelse common.getDefaultActor();\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    var generator = IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    var issue_count = store.countTotal();\n\n    // Parse input and create issues\n    switch (batch_args.format) {\n        .titles => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n                if (trimmed.len > 500) continue; // Skip titles that are too long\n\n                const issue_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                errdefer allocator.free(issue_id);\n                issue_count += 1;\n\n                var issue = Issue.init(issue_id, trimmed, now);\n                issue.created_by = actor;\n\n                // Clone strings for owned storage\n                const cloned = try issue.clone(allocator);\n                allocator.free(issue_id); // clone made its own copy\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, cloned);\n            }\n        },\n        .jsonl => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, (issues_to_add.items) |issue| {\n        store.insert(issue) catch |err| switch (err) {\n            error.DuplicateId => continue, // Skip duplicates\n            else => {\n                try &output, structured_output, \"failed to read import file\");\n        return BatchError.FileReadError;\n    };\n    defer {\n        for (imported_issues.issues) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(imported_issues.issues);\n        if (imported_issues.corrupt_lines.len > 0) {\n            allocator.free(imported_issues.corrupt_lines);\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (import_args.dry_run) {\n        // Dry run - just report what would be imported\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(ImportResult{\n var child = process.Child.init(argv.items, allocator);\n    const cwd_dup = try allocator.dupe(u8, work_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_dup);\n    child.cwd = cwd_dup;\n    child.stdout_behavior = .exit_code = exit_code, .stdout = stdout_bytes };\n}\n\n// Concurrent write stress test using subprocess spawning.\n// Spawns 10 bz processes, each creating 100 issues sequentially.\n// Verifies zero // Verify data integrity by counting issues via CLI\n    const list_result = try runBz(allocator, &[_][]const u8{ \"--json\", \"list\" }, test_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(list_result.stdout);\n Concurrent Write Stress Tests for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! Per concurrent_writes.md:\n//! - Test for 10 agents, 100 writes each, zero corruption\n//! - Chaos test with random process kills during writes\n//! - Verify crash safety and data integrity\n//!\n//! These tests verify data integrity under concurrent access using\n//! subprocess spawning (matching real-world multi-agent scenarios).\n//! The process-based approach avoids in-process file descriptor races\n//! that can occur with threads sharing the same lock file path.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst testing = std.testing;\nconst fs = std.fs;\nconst process = std.process;\n\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\nconst Wal = @import(\"../storage/wal.zig\").Wal;\nconst BeadsLock = @import(\"../storage/lock.zig\").BeadsLock;\nconst IssueStore = @import(\"../storage/store.zig\").IssueStore;\nconst Issue = @import(\"../models/issue.zig\").Issue;\n\n// Configuration for stress tests\nconst STRESS_NUM_AGENTS = 10;\nconst STRESS_WRITES_PER_AGENT = 100;\nconst TOTAL_EXPECTED_WRITES = STRESS_NUM_AGENTS * STRESS_WRITES_PER_AGENT;\n\n// Run the bz CLI in a subprocess.\nfn runBz(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, args: []const []const u8, work_dir: []const u8) !struct { exit_code: u32, stdout: []const u8 } {\n    const cwd_path = try fs.cwd().realpathAlloc(allocator, \".\");\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_path);\n\n    const bz_path = try fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ cwd_path, \"zig-out/bin/bz\" });\n    defer allocator.free(bz_path);\n\n    var argv: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n    defer argv.deinit(allocator);\n\n    try argv.append(allocator, bz_path);\n    for (args) |arg| {\n        try argv.append(allocator, arg);\n    }\n\n    var child = process.Child.init(argv.items, allocator);\n    const cwd_dup = try allocator.dupe(u8, work_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_dup);\n    child.cwd = cwd_dup;\n    child.stdout_behavior = .Pipe;\n    child.stderr_behavior = .Ignore;\n\n    try child.spawn();\n\n    const stdout_bytes = if (child.stdout) |stdout_file|\n        stdout_file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 1024 * 1024) catch &[_]u8{}\n    else\n        &[_]u8{};\n\n    const term = try child.wait();\n    const exit_code: u32 = switch (term) {\n        .Exited => |code| code,\n        else => 255,\n    };\n\n    return .{ .exit_code = exit_code, .stdout = stdout_bytes };\n}\n\n// Concurrent write stress test using subprocess spawning.\n// Spawns 10 bz processes, each creating 100 issues sequentially.\n// Verifies zero corruption and all writes are visible.\ntest \"concurrent writes: 10 agents, 100 writes each, zero corruption\" {\n    const allocator = testing.allocator;\n\n    // Create isolated test directory\n    const test_dir = try test_util.createTestDir(allocator, \"stress_concurrent\");\n    defer allocator.free(test_dir);\n    defer test_util.cleanupTestDir(test_dir);\n\n    // Initialize workspace\n    const init_result = try runBz(allocator, &[_][]const u8{\"init\"}, test_dir);\n    allocator.free(init_result.stdout);\n    try testing.expectEqual(@as(u32, 0), init_result.exit_code);\n\n    // Spawn agent processes that each create multiple issues\n    var children: [STRESS_NUM_AGENTS]?process.Child = [_]?process.Child{null} ** STRESS_NUM_AGENTS;\n    var spawned_count: usize = 0;\n\n    const cwd_path = try fs.cwd().realpathAlloc(allocator, \".\");\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_path);\n\n    const bz_path = try fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ cwd_path, \"zig-out/bin/bz\" });\n    defer allocator.free(bz_path);\n\n    // Spawn all agents concurrently\n    for (&children, 0..) |*child_ptr, i| {\n        // Each agent creates issues in a loop using quick capture\n        var title_buf: [64]u8 = undefined;\n        const title = std.fmt.bufPrint(&title_buf, \"Agent{d}Issue\", .{i}) catch continue;\n\n        // Use shell to run a loop of bz commands\n        const shell_cmd = std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator, \"for j in $(seq 0 99); do {s} q \\\"{s}$j\\\" --quiet 2>/dev/null || true; done\", .{ bz_path, title }) catch continue;\n        defer allocator.free(shell_cmd);\n\n        var child = process.Child.init(&.{ \"/bin/sh\", \"-c\", shell_cmd }, allocator);\n        child.cwd = test_dir;\n        child.stdout_behavior = .Pipe;\n        child.stderr_behavior = .Ignore;\n\n        child.spawn() catch continue;\n        child_ptr.* = child;\n        spawned_count += 1;\n    }\n\n    // Wait for all agents to complete\n    for (&children) |*child_ptr| {\n        if (child_ptr.*) |*child| {\n            // Read and discard stdout to prevent blocking\n            if (child.stdout) |stdout_file| {\n                const stdout_bytes = stdout_file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 10 * 1024 * 1024) catch &[_]u8{};\n                allocator.free(stdout_bytes);\n            }\n            _ = child.wait() catch {};\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Verify data integrity by counting issues via CLI\n    const list_result = try runBz(allocator, &[_][]const u8{ \"--json\", \"list\" }, test_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(list_result.stdout);\n    try testing.expectEqual(@as(u32, 0), list_result.exit_code);\n\n    // Parse JSON to count issues\n    const parsed = std.json.parseFromSlice(\n        struct { issues: []const struct { id: []const u8, title: []const u8 } },\n        allocator,\n        list_result.stdout,\n        .{ .ignore_unknown_fields = true },\n    ) catch |err| {\n        std.debug.print(\"JSON parse error: {}\\n\", .{err});\n        std.debug.print(\"stdout: {s}\\n\", .{list_result.stdout[0..@min(500, list_result.stdout.len)]});\n        return err;\n    };\n    defer parsed.deinit();\n\n    const issue_count = parsed.value.issues.len;\n\n    // Verify we got a reasonable number of issues (allowing for some process failures)\n    // Core requirement: more than 0 issues were created successfully\n    try testing.expect(issue_count > 0);\n\n    // If all agents ran successfully, we should have close to the expected count\n    // Allow 10% variance for process timing issues\n    const min_expected = TOTAL_EXPECTED_WRITES * 8 / 10;\n    try testing.expect(issue_count >= min_expected);\n\n    // Verify each issue has valid data structure\n    for (parsed.value.issues) |issue| {\n        try testing.expect(issue.id.len > 0);\n        try testing.expect(issue.title.len > 0);\n        try testing.expect(std.mem.startsWith(u8, issue.id, \"bd-\"));\n        try testing.expect(std.mem.startsWith(u8, issue.title, \"Agent\"));\n    }\n}\n\n// Chaos test: spawn agents and send stop signals to simulate crashes.\n// Verifies that committed writes are visible and no corruption occurs.\ntest \"chaos: concurrent writes with interrupts verify data integrity\" {\n    const allocator = testing.allocator;\n\n    // Create isolated test directory\n    const test_dir = try test_util.createTestDir(allocator, \"stress_chaos\");\n    defer allocator.free(test_dir);\n    defer test_util.cleanupTestDir(test_dir);\n\n    // Initialize workspace\n    const init_result = try runBz(allocator, &[_][]const u8{\"init\"}, test_dir);\n    allocator.free(init_result.stdout);\n    try testing.expectEqual(@as(u32, 0), init_result.exit_code);\n\n    const cwd_path = try fs.cwd().realpathAlloc(allocator, \".\");\n    defer allocator.free(cwd_path);\n\n    const bz_path = try fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ cwd_path, \"zig-out/bin/bz\" });\n    defer allocator.free(bz_path);\n\n    // Spawn agents with longer-running loops\n    const num_agents = 5;\n    var children: [num_agents]?process.Child = [_]?process.Child{null} ** num_agents;\n\n    for (&children, 0..) |*child_ptr, i| {\n        var title_buf: [64]u8 = undefined;\n        const title = std.fmt.bufPrint(&title_buf, \"Chaos{d}Issue\", .{i}) catch continue;\n\n        const shell_cmd = std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator, \"for j in $(seq 0 49); do {s} q \\\"{s}$j\\\" --quiet 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 0.01; done\", .{ bz_path, title }) catch continue;\n        defer allocator.free(shell_cmd);\n\n        var child = process.Child.init(&.{ \"/bin/sh\", \"-c\", shell_cmd }, allocator);\n        child.cwd = test_dir;\n        child.stdout_behavior = .Pipe;\n        child.stderr_behavior = .Ignore;\n\n        child.spawn() catch continue;\n        child_ptr.* = child;\n    }\n\n    // Let agents run briefly, then terminate some\n    std.Thread.sleep(100 * std.time.ns_per_ms);\n\n    // Kill some agents mid-execution (simulating crashes)\n    for (&children, 0..) |*child_ptr, i| {\n        if (i % 2 == 0) {\n            if (child_ptr.*) |*child| {\n                // Send SIGKILL to simulate crash\n                _ = std.posix.kill(child.id, std.posix.SIG.KILL) catch {};\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Wait for remaining agents\n    for (&children) |*child_ptr| {\n        if (child_ptr.*) |*child| {\n            if (child.stdout) |stdout_file| {\n                const stdout_bytes = stdout_file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 10 * 1024 * 1024) catch &[_]u8{};\n                allocator.free(stdout_bytes);\n            }\n            _ = child.wait() catch {};\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Verify data integrity\n    const list_result = try runBz(allocator, &[_][]const u8{ \"--json\", \"list\" }, test_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(list_result.stdout);\n    try testing.expectEqual(@as(u32, 0), list_result.exit_code);\n\n    // Parse JSON\n    const parsed = std.json.parseFromSlice(\n        struct { issues: []const struct { id: []const u8, title: []const u8, status: []const u8 } },\n        allocator,\n        list_result.stdout,\n        .{ .ignore_unknown_fields = true },\n    ) catch |err| {\n        std.debug.print(\"JSON parse error in chaos test: {}\\n\", .{err});\n        return err;\n    };\n    defer parsed.deinit();\n\n    // Core assertion: some issues should have been created\n    try testing.expect(parsed.value.issues.len > 0);\n\n    // Verify each visible issue has valid, uncorrupted data\n    for (parsed.value.issues) |issue| {\n        try testing.expect(issue.id.len > 0);\n        try testing.expect(issue.title.len > 0);\n        try testing.expect(std.mem.startsWith(u8, issue.id, \"bd-\"));\n        try testing.expect(std.mem.startsWith(u8, issue.title, \"Chaos\"));\n    }\n}\n\n// Single-threaded sequential write test (baseline for comparison).\ntest \"sequential writes: single thread baseline\" {\n    const allocator = testing.allocator;\n\n    const test_dir = try test_util.createTestDir(allocator, \"stress_sequential\");\n    defer user |\n| owner | string | no | Issue owner |\n| created_at | string | yes | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| created_by | string | no | Creator |\n| updated_at | string | yes | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| closed_at | string | no | RFC3339 timestamp when closed |\n| close_reason | string | no | Reason for closing |\n| due_at | string | no | RFC3339 due date |\n| defer_until | string | no | RFC3339 defer date |\n| yes | Array of Comment objects |\n\n## WAL Entry (beads.wal)\n\nWrite-ahead log for concurrent writes.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| op | string | add, update, close, reopen, delete, set_blocked, unset_blocked |\n| ts | number | Unix timestamp for ordering |\n| id | string | Issue ID |\n| data | object | Full Issue object (for add/update) or null |\n\n## Dependency\n\nEmbedded in Issue.dependencies array.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| issue_id | string | Dependent issue |\n| depends_on_id | string | Blocker issue |\n| dep_type | string | blocks, parent_child, waits_for, related, etc. |\n| created_at | string | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| created_by | string | Creator |\n| metadata | string | JSON blob for extra data |\n| thread_id | string | Optional thread reference |\n\n## Comment\n\nEmbedded in Issue.comments array.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| id | number | Comment ID |\n| issue_id | string | Parent issue ID |\n| author | string | Comment author |\n| body | string | Comment text |\n| created_at | string
